repnme.cdata!:
Guinea - Conakry Water Supply and
            Sanitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Conakry Water Supply
            and Sanitation Project for Guinea was marginally
            satisfactory. The project achieved some of its objectives,
            institutional development was negligible, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of the Bank was satisfactory
            while the Borrower's was less than satisfactory.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First,
            DEG, as presently constituted, is not competent to be
            responsible for both project implementation and system
            operation and maintenance. Second, the responsible authority
            should not be subject to detailed control or interference
            from above. Third, in return, the water authority must
            accept responsibility for its performance in the fields of:
            1) operation and maintenance; 2) metering, billing, and
            collection; and 3) internal control systems and accounting
            procedures. Finally, while substantial technical assistance
            is still needed, it is clear from experience under this
            project that this will be fruitless again unless accompanied
            by a radical reshaping of institutional responsibilities.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea - Conakry Water Supply and
            Sanitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims to fulfill the
            immediate water supply and drainage needs of Conakry,
            provide satisfactory sanitation to most of its population,
            and strengthen institutions operating in the sector. It
            would be executed over the period 1979-1983 and would: (a)
            construct transmission and distribution mains and pipes,
            reservoirs, a booster pumping station, and a treatment
            facility, and drill, rehabilitate and equip boreholes; (b)
            provide house connections, standpipes, water meters and
            related equipment and materials; (c) purchase chemicals and
            small vehicles for services responsible for well inspection
            and disinfection; (d) upgrade drainage ditches; (e) install
            10 sanitary blocks (for drinking and washing) in low-income
            parts of Conakry; (f) provide 39 man-years of technical
            assistance and consulting services and 20 man-years of
            fellowships; (g) establish a training program within DEG;
            and (h) construct housing, and training and office space.

docna.cdata!: Guinea - Conakry Water Supply and Sanitation Project
